title: FBI on The Sopranos
data: Fabian Febby Petrulio AKA Fred Peters
Former soldier , turned State 's Witness , kicked out of witness protection
Executed by Tony Soprano in the first-season episode College
Executed by Silvio Dante in the first-season episode I Dream of Jeannie Cusamano
Executed by Tony Soprano , Silvio Dante , and Paulie Gualtieri in the second-season episode , Funhouse
Fiancée of Christopher Moltisanti and Crazy Horse club manager in Long Branch , New Jersey
Executed by Silvio Dante in the fifth-season episode , Long Term Parking
Died as a result of a stroke in the sixth-season episode , Members Only
Business associate , Massarone Construction Corp. founder and CEO ,
Executed on orders from Tony Soprano in the fifth-season episode , Rat Pack after having aroused suspicions of Patrick Parisi
Unknown , presumably Petrille has since entered the Witness Protection Program ( although this has not been mentioned )
Committed suicide by hanging in the sixth-season episode , Members Only . The amount of information that he contributed , if any , is highly questionable
Unknown . Turned informant on the series finale Made in America . His future and the ramifications of his testimony against Tony are unknown
Became informant due to son , wannabe mobster Jason being arrested for drug dealing
intro: A major plotline on the fictional HBO drama The Sopranos was the U.S. Federal Bureau of Investigation's ongoing pursuit of the DiMeo (New Jersey) and Lupertazzi (Brooklyn) crime families. The Bureau's investigations met with varying degrees of success. This article lists both characters who acted as F.B.I. informants and F.B.I. agent characters and as such is an expansion of the main article List of The Sopranos characters.
